timelineTitle: Fetal Development: From Conception to Birth

events.title: Fertilization
events.description: Fertilization marks the genesis of human development as a single spermatozoon breaches the zona pellucida, triggering completion of meiosis II and the formation of distinct male and female pronuclei that restore the diploid chromosome complement.
events.prompt: Illustration style: A detailed image of Fertilization. hand-drawn illustration style, detailed linework, rich textures, artistic composition, storybook aesthetic. 21th century period detail, historically accurate. Balanced composition, centered focal point, clear visual storytelling. SERIES CONSISTENCY: Use a consistent documentary photography style: soft, even lighting from above (like a medical/scientific photograph), neutral background (white or light gray), centered subject composition, same scale and magnification level, clinical/educational aesthetic. Maintain this exact visual approach across all images in the series - same lighting direction, same background color, same composition style, same level of detail. Images should look like they were photographed in the same scientific documentation session. No text, no words, no written content, no labels. Pure visual scene without any readable text or letters
events.promptFromStep3: Anchor: “medically accurate illustration documentary series—soft, even, top-down museum-lighting that reveals form without drama; muted palette of translucent amniotic pinks, warm cartilage peach, soft arterial reds, chalk-white skeletal highlights and desaturated taupe backgrounds to keep continuity; every stage shown as a centered, life-size sagittal cut-away floating in a seamless parchment-beige void, consistent 30° upward perspective, identical 70 mm equivalent scale, delicate linework and watercolor-wash textures, subtle gestational-week annotation placed lower left in unobtrusive 10 pt Helvetica Neue light.” A single spermatozoon penetrating the zona pellucida of an oocyte, while the second polar body is extruded and male and female pronuclei form, restoring the diploid chromosome number.

events.title: Implantation
events.description: Implantation commences on post-fertilization day 7–8 when the trophoblast differentiates into cytotrophoblast and syncytiotrophoblast layers, penetrating the decidualized endometrium and establishing primitive uteroplacental circulation by day 10.
events.prompt: Illustration style: A detailed image of Implantation. hand-drawn illustration style, detailed linework, rich textures, artistic composition, storybook aesthetic. 21th century period detail, historically accurate. Balanced composition, centered focal point, clear visual storytelling. SERIES CONSISTENCY: Use a consistent documentary photography style: soft, even lighting from above (like a medical/scientific photograph), neutral background (white or light gray), centered subject composition, same scale and magnification level, clinical/educational aesthetic. Maintain this exact visual approach across all images in the series - same lighting direction, same background color, same composition style, same level of detail. Images should look like they were photographed in the same scientific documentation session. No text, no words, no written content, no labels. Pure visual scene without any readable text or letters

events.title: Neural Tube Formation
events.description: Neural tube formation unfolds between days 21–27 as the neural plate elevates into folds that fuse first at the cervical region, closing cranial and caudal neuropores to establish the future central nervous system.
events.prompt: Illustration style: A detailed image of Neural Tube Formation. hand-drawn illustration style, detailed linework, rich textures, artistic composition, storybook aesthetic. 21th century period detail, historically accurate. events.title: Heartbeat Begins
events.description: The primitive heart tube begins rhythmic peristaltic contractions on day 22–23, looping into an S-shape with distinguishable atrial and ventricular dilations while blood flow becomes visible through the translucent myocardial wall.
events.prompt: Illustration style: A detailed image of Heartbeat Begins. hand-drawn illustration style, detailed linework, rich textures, artistic composition, storybook aesthetic. 21th century period detail, historically accurate. events.title: Limb Buds Appear
events.description: Limb buds emerge as lateral ectodermal ridges during weeks 4–5, with upper buds appearing days 24–26 followed by lower buds days 26–28, each capped by an apical ectodermal ridge that orchestrates proximo-distal outgrowth.
events.prompt: “medically accurate illustration documentary series—soft, even, top-down museum-lighting that reveals form without drama; muted palette of translucent amniotic pinks, warm cartilage peach, soft arterial reds, chalk-white skeletal highlights and desaturated taupe backgrounds to keep continuity; every stage shown as a centered, life-size sagittal cut-away floating in a seamless parchment-beige void, consistent 30° upward perspective, identical 70 mm equivalent scale, delicate linework and watercolor-wash textures, subtle gestational-week annotation placed lower left in unobtrusive 10 pt Helvetica Neue light.”. events.title: Facial Features Develop
events.description: Facial morphogenesis becomes apparent through the fusion of five primordia—frontonasal, paired maxillary, and mandibular prominences—while nasal pits invaginate and palatal shelves initiate midline fusion.
events.prompt: “medically accurate illustration documentary series—soft, even, top-down museum-lighting that reveals form without drama; muted palette of translucent amniotic pinks, warm cartilage peach, soft arterial reds, chalk-white skeletal highlights and desaturated taupe backgrounds to keep continuity; every stage shown as a centered, life-size sagittal cut-away floating in a seamless parchment-beige void, consistent 30° upward perspective, identical 70 mm equivalent scale, delicate linework and watercolor-wash textures, subtle gestational-week annotation placed lower left in unobtrusive 10 pt Helvetica Neue light.”. The scene shows A fetus showing five facial primordia—frontonasal prominence, paired maxillary and mandibular prominences—with nasal pits forming as ectodermal invaginations and primary palate fusion initiating.. hand-drawn illustration style, detailed linework, rich textures, artistic composition, storybook aesthetic. 21th century period detail, historically accurate. events.title: Fingers and Toes Form
events.description: Digital identity is sculpted between days 41–52 as interdigital notches form via programmed apoptosis, yielding free fingertips by day 48 and complete toe separation by day 52, with early nail fields marking dorsal digit tips.

events.title: External Genitals Develop
events.description: External genitalia progress through an indifferent stage into sexually dimorphic structures between weeks 9–12, as the genital tubercle elongates, urethral grooves form, and labioscrotal swellings migrate to their final positions.

events.title: Fingernails Form
events.description: Fingernail development commences week 10 with establishment of nail fields on dorsal distal phalanges, followed by matrix differentiation and keratinization that produces visible nail plates at fingertip by week 14.

events.title: Fetus Begins to Move
events.description: Active fetal movements begin with spontaneous trunk flexion weeks 7–8, advancing to limb bud twitching, head rotation, and complex generalized movements by week 12, including hiccup-like diaphragmatic contractions.
events.prompt: “medically accurate illustration documentary series—soft, even, top-down museum-lighting that reveals form without drama; muted palette of translucent amniotic pinks, warm cartilage peach, soft arterial reds, chalk-white skeletal highlights and desaturated taupe backgrounds to keep continuity; every stage shown as a centered, life-size sagittal cut-away floating in a seamless parchment-beige void, consistent 30° upward perspective, identical 70 mm equivalent scale, delicate linework and watercolor-wash textures, subtle gestational-week annotation placed lower left in unobtrusive 10 pt Helvetica Neue light.”. events.title: Heartbeat Detectable
events.description: Cardiac activity becomes detectable via transvaginal ultrasound at 5.5–6.0 weeks when fetal pole length exceeds 2 mm, exhibiting an initial rate of 90–110 bpm that accelerates to 140–170 bpm by week 9.

events.title: Fetus Develops Reflexes
events.description: Reflex arcs mature with the appearance of the startle reflex weeks 8–9, followed by palmar and plantar grasp reflexes weeks 11–13, coordinated sucking-swallowing movements week 12, and blink-startle responses to light touch week 16.

events.title: Fetus Gains Weight
events.description: Accelerated weight gain occurs from week 16 onward, doubling from 100 g to 200 g by week 20, tripling from 1,000 g to 3,000 g weeks 32–38, with linear growth of 100–150 g per week during the third trimester.

events.title: Fetus Develops Body Fat
events.description: Adipose tissue deposition begins week 20 in neck and axilla, forming a discernible subcutaneous layer by week 24, expanding into cheek and buttock fat pads week 30, ultimately composing 15–16% of body weight at term.
